title: Vegan coconut curry
portion: hands-on time 25 min, cooking time 25 min
description: This vegan coconut curry uses firm tofu for its ‘meatier’ texture and is jam-packed with fresh, zingy flavours from the curry leaves, coconut, tamarind and cumin.
ingredients: 2 tbsp light olive oil or coconut oil
2 x 280g packs firm tofu, cut into chunks and dried on kitchen paper
4 large spring onions, white and green parts sliced separately
1 tbsp tamarind paste, plus extra to drizzle

method.Step 1: Heat the oil in a wide, heavy-based pan over a medium heat, add the tofu and brown for around 2-3 minutes on each side until golden. Remove from the pan and set aside.

method.Step 2: Add the chopped white parts of the spring onions, the garlic, half the chilli/es and all the cumin seeds to the pan, mix well and fry for 1 minute, then add the curry leaves and fry for another minute.

method.Step 3: Add the coconut milk and 200ml cold water (or veg stock if you have it), then simmer gently over a low-medium heat for 10 minutes, being careful not to let the curry boil or it will split. Add back the tofu, peas and broccoli, then cook for 5 minutes or so until just cooked. Stir in 1 tbsp tamarind paste, then cook for another 1-2 minutes.

method.Step 4: Serve sprinkled with the green parts of the spring onion and an extra drizzle of tamarind paste.
